lines.text: Ted, why did you have to have a sister?
Why anyone is simple minded enough to want to work on a newspaper I've never been able to find out.
Why Mr. Bostwick, journalism is a very noble and glorious career. With all the adventure and romance and everything I'd think you would just love it.
Every time I depend on a reporter, I'm double-crossed.
A reporter has the right to do things an ordinary person shouldn't.
Ted, I'm positive that the woman who stole the tin can from me yesterday is Soxie's girlfriend. Now all you have to do is get him to tell you her name and where she lives.
Maybe you'd like to know if she's got any bridgework! How will that help?
You remember Captain Tweety always said, "Cherchez la femme!" - find the woman! - the only smart thing he ever did say!
It's true! You can always get information from women. They just love to talk!

[to Ted as the murderer is headed for their room]
Well! Do something!
I guess it's just my women's intuition, but she just doesn't look like the type to poison anybody.
